message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

This paper is about a digital infrastructure for language resource discovery, which involves natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) techniques. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of controlled vocabularies, which is related to information retrieval and data management, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) another likely sub-category. The use of digital archives and metadata sets suggests cs.DL (Digital Libraries) as a possible sub-category. The paper also mentions the expansion of the language resources community, which could be related to cs.LG (Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as these fields often involve community building and collaboration.
